I saw this movie in theater on my city late, and i think it wouldn't be crowded, but it still. This animation would be loved from all ages.

Author: 25 December 2005
Review_Url: This is the boringest movie you will ever see. Its about this fish.A kid fish.His dad is overprotective of his son on account of his wife got killed by a barracuda along with over 400 eggs.Only one egg survived.He names it nemo which is the name his wife wanted. Anyway nemo finally has to go to school.....but his father would rather have him wait for a few more years.But nemo wanted to go so he went.And while he was there he and a few friends sneak away from the group to the drop off. Just as nemo is about to swim into open water his father-who had been there the whole time-Stops him.He is convinced that nemo should wait to go to school and nemo hates him for it.So while his dad is not looking he swims out to a boat. He gets captured by a diver and his dad goes across the ocean to find him and goes though a lot to get there.I wont revile any more than that.

Author: 24 November 2003
Review: This is What Animation is All About
Review_Url: Take cutting edge computer animation, add a stellar vocal cast, mix liberally with spectacular visual effects and a laugh-out-loud funny script, and you get something approaching "Finding Nemo".  Trying to describe the movie would be as unsatisfactory as trying to describe what chocolate tastes like to a person who has never tasted it.

Author: 6 June 2003
Review: Very good movie. Very funny and a great message for all ages.
Review_Url: This is a very good movie.  Very funny and a great message for all ages. I was impressed with the graphics, characters, and the story.  Finally a movie you can take a 3 year old to see and not have to worry about hidden messages, and inappropriate comments, but can also be enjoyed by adults.

Author: 29 December 2018
Review_Url:
Encore un grand classique de l'animation!
C'est un film dont je me souviendrai toujours,

Author: 31 May 2003
Review_Url: I took my three children, ages 2, 4 and 8 to see this film. They really enjoyed it - there was enough humor to keep them engaged and the bright colors and fun characters kept them watching instead of fidgeting as they do at lesser family fare. What I really liked were the little bits of adult humor sprinkled throughout. The kids found it funny, but the adults actually found it funnier. Disney and Pixar have once again created a fun family film that we won't mind watching over again in the years to come.

Author: 27 February 2023
Review_Url: I like it because it is Australian mate. I like the seagulls because they go like MOIT MOIT. My mum likes the pelican because he smashes into the window all the time. I like Eric Bana in it and the other guy. My mums favourite characters in it are probably Dory, the pelican, Nemo and the fish that's like BUBBLES! BUBBLES! It has a really good storyline. It is insanely funny, well maybe not insanely funny like very funny. My brother also really likes it. He likes the seagulls like me. Finally my dad thinks it is pretty good. I think dory is pretty funny as well. It is funny when she runs into marlin, Nemo's dad.

Author: 7 July 2010
Review_Url: What more can one say about one of the most remarkable studios in Hollywood's history. Despite the profit-munching monolithic beast that is Disney, constantly peering over Pixar's shoulder to ensure profits are aplenty in every new feature, this never seems to distract such a remarkable studio from making pieces of pure art. That is what Finding Nemo is, art. From the glorious animation that brings the South-West Pacific alive on-screen, to the peaceful, pitch-perfect score, combined with the art of creating great characters and story, something that Pixar has always excelled at, creates a beautiful film experience.

Author: 16 June 2011
Review: Finding Nemo is a remarkable Pixar film.
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is a remarkable Pixar film. A clown fish named Marlin, whose voice is Albert Brooks, family gets destroyed by a barracuda, but one egg survived. Marlin names the egg Nemo, whose voice is Alexander Gould. Marlin devotes his life to make sure Nemo stays protected and safe. Marlin pushes Nemo's limits, and Nemo adventures off in the mysterious ocean. Nemo is than captured by a diver and Marlin starts a search through the frightening ocean to save his son. Marlin runs into a fish name Dory, whose voice is Ellen DeGeneres, which joins him for the search.

Author: 28 December 2003
Review_Url: For a long time, I was (and still am) skeptical about Disney movies, whichever size and shape they come in. About 7 minutes into this one I was saying to myself, "The artwork is amazing, CG (*I'm a computer person, so I yearn for really cool, CPU-intensive CG*) is totally unrivaled, but the story line sucks so bad, why I am watching another Disney tear-squeezer??"

Author: 6 July 2003
Review_Url: A must-see movie for kids of all ages.

Author: 1 May 2004
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is a modern animated masterpiece

Author: 5 June 2003
Review_Url: Absolutely amazing movie.  Disney/Pixar have definitely out-done themselves. The animation must get an A++ as well as everything else.  The plot line was great, and they couldn't have picked better actors/actress' for the voices.  A must see. I assure you that you will not be disappointed. I'll be seeing it again for sure.  2 thumbs up! 10 stars!

Author: 1 June 2003
Review: Not Bad, But It's no Toy Story
Review_Url: Finding Nemo was clever, cute, well written and definitely a technical advance in animated story telling.  It doesn't compare, however, to the first Pixar film I viewed - Toy Story.

Author: 14 June 2003
Review: One of the best children's movie in a long time...
Review_Url: Finding Nemo has some of the best lessons to be learned.  It was maybe a little more personal to me because I have a close relative (child) with a handicap similar to Nemo's.  It has the tragedy (almost as heartwrenching as The Lion King), but it is a sweet, wonderful story about learning how to let go and how to understand and accept other people for who they are.

Author: 22 September 2003
Review_Url: The  underwater sequences where spectacular, enriched with bright colors and fantastic effects. The story line was a little to simple for me and yet is probaly the best family adventure of the year with a light humour that gets all of the little kids laughing at every bump of a fish which can get a little irritating at the cinemas.

Author: 27 November 2011
Review_Url: I love to watch animated movies. I find them so entertaining, even though most people would say that those types of movies were meant for little kids I don't think that I will ever out grow them. Finding Nemo (2003) directed by Andrew Stanton and Lee Unkrich is in my opinion one of the best movies. Little kids love to watch these animated pictures, they teach kids and help them form an understanding of the world. Most of Pixar films, if not all of Pixar's films have a message in them, something the creator wants us to get out of the film besides watching it for merely our entertainment. Compared to a Disney movie, Pixar pictures have no magic; problems in the movie can't be solved by a wave of a wand or by a fairy godmother. Furthermore, humans are rarely the main characters and most of the films the protagonist is a non human character. In Finding Nemo there are humans in the story however, they play a small role in the film. We also see that in this picture the villain or the antagonist is human for example, Darla, they don't play a big role in the film but they sometimes support the antagonist. In Finding Nemo we see a clown fish, Marlin who is very protective of his only son, Nemo. And with this, already a lot of people can relate. Many parents are overprotective for their child and do not want them to venture out on their own because of the possibility of them getting hurt. Parents are so scared of letting go and letting them explore the world on their own. While watching the film we also see Marlin overcome his fear of the ocean as he travels with Dorothy to find his son. This is probably the most relatable message in the movie with both kids and adults. We all have fears and overcoming them can be really hard but sooner or later we realize that there was nothing to be afraid of. When we see Nemo is stuck in a fish tank at a dentist office Nemo and his new found fish friends try to help him escape. However, it all goes wrong and everyone gave up on the idea because it was dangerous and could've hurt Nemo. But Nemo does not give up he goes and tries again this time succeeding in stopping the water filter. The film attempts to change our lives for the better. For parents its saying that there's a time where you have to let go of your kids being overprotective can be a bad thing and it can lead to your kids getting annoyed/frustrated and refusing to listen to you. For kids, it's to tell them that your parents care and they want to protect you. Also to never give up in anything they do. These messages are universal they apply to everyone around the world. The theme in this film I think is relevant to any parent watching it. Scared of letting go of their kids, being very overprotective, the fear of losing their kids almost every parent can relate to this.

Author: 25 July 2008
Review_Url: when compared to the great Disney movies this film is really pathetic. i couldn't wait for it to be over.

Author: 25 October 2005
Review_Url: Toy Story again, but with fishes.

Author: 7 March 2018
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is to begin with a movie with stunning visual effects and editing, the perspectives and colors are just amazing.

Author: 9 July 2003
Review_Url: Okay, I admit it, I am a Disney fan, so deal with it.

Author: 28 July 2003
Review_Url: My 19 year old daughter kept telling me to see this that I would enjoy it and she was right. It was perfectly entertaining for an adult female in her early fifties even without the excuse of escorting a child to the film.

Author: 13 November 2003
Review_Url: There's no way this movie is better than "The Deer Hunter," "Notorious," or any of the other movies that have recently been edged out of the top 100 list. It was a nice movie, the animation was very fluid, and I wasn't bored, and that's about all I can say in favor of it. If you want even the slightest intellectual stimulation, search elsewhere, but if you're interested in having a basic message pounded into your head throughout the course of the an hour and a half, then by all means give it a try.

Author: 3 June 2003
Review_Url: Ellen Degeneres is FANTASTIC as the voice of Dory in this movie, she totally makes the movie.  Her character keeps you laughing from beginning to end, even during the parts where you feel like crying!  She has a lot of talent, and the role was perfect for her sense of humor.  The rest of that case also does an excellent job, I felt as if Disney made a quality effort to make this just as enjoyable for adults as for children, except for the poor little boy that sat behind me in the theater, "It's too scary Mommy, I wanna go home!"  All of the other children really seemed to be having a good time.

Author: 5 August 2003
Review_Url: So pretty and so funny.  This is great entertainment with dazzling visuals and a really funny script.  I rarely laugh out loud but I did in this movie. The reefs and sea life sometimes looks so real and other times better than real.  Never mind the kids, I want to see it again!

Author: 5 December 2003
Review_Url: Not having small children, I have had no great desire to see this highly touted work.  My wife rented it, and I was willing...  Yes, it was interesting to watch from a technical standpoint, but there was little else to hold my attention.  Besides the animation, Ellen DeGeneres' work was the only real redeeming quality - she was wonderful.  It is surely for kids and their parents.

Author: 31 May 2003
Review_Url: The undersea adventure that Pixar presents is undoubtedly more fleshed out than Disney's "Little Mermaid". The characters are 'human', not just the bland sidekicks found in Disney movies, and the society of "Fish Predators Anonymous" was hilarious. Willem Dafoe is brilliant as the morose Gill.

Author: 4 May 2008
Review_Url: "Nemo" had a great advertising just like other films (Shrek, The Incredibles, Chicken Little), and their grand success can be partially explained that way. "Nemo" was promoted like another rebirth of Disney and the greatest picture Pixar has never made. The graphics were outstanding, although I was never keen of seeing more than one time 3D animated movies. The original concept, although not very original, was good for standing away from the silly-piggish-not-that-funny-dull-stupid script that 3D animated computer features had taken (aka Shrek, Shark Tale, Madagascar, Shrek II and III, and just because they enjoy to milk the cow, maybe IV, V, VI...). "Nemo" stands aside from this. But are some negative aspects. While watching this movie on cinema, some little kids fell asleep during the second part and most of them claimed that the film was just too long and the adults complained about the slow story pace. I can say the same. The thing with Nemo's mother death was so unoriginal, that they even called this "Bambi and The Lion King deep in the sea" The parts with Nemo trapped in the dentist office were boring and with its develop, even Marlin and Dory plot with their "platonic love" was going the same way. A good soundtrack could easily distract the audience but there was no good soundtrack and not even bad. There was none. Some Disney films needed some time but this should be cut at half.

Author: 1 June 2003
Review: Two thumbs way, way up! Pixar shines again!
Review_Url: I confess, I wasn't sure about Finding Nemo from the trailers. I was a little worried that this was a classic case of all the laugh lines being packed into a 2 minute version of the film.

Author: 1 August 2003
Review: Following in the footsteps of Shrek, NEMO exceeds in humor
Review_Url: Well, I can honestly say... I'm 23 and a guy, yet for one reason or another I find myself put in these situations to watch Children's movies. I've seen Shrek, which I loved. Now, I've seen Finding Nemo, which I love MORE. Ellen Degeneres had me, as well as other adults there with their children, cracking up throughout the movie and I'm not afraid to admit it. While I hate Albert Brooks with a passion, he was perfect for the role of Nemo's father (voice wise). He, however, was the only character I hated. But I loved all the Tank Fish, and Dory, and the Sharks, & others were all wonderful. I think any open minded person who can enjoy a laugh, or who can remember their youth, would enjoy this movie. For Children it is a fun cartoon full of adventure and surprise. For Adults it is a great movie that makes you reflect on your youth, and if you are a parent, yourself as a parent. It also gives you laughs you'd never expect to have in a movie like this. While Shrek was meaningful and romantic, Finding Nemo was hilarious and really got you into it and has another message to get to everyone and I HIGHLY Recommend you see this before it leaves theatres, and if it's too late.. Go out and get it on DVD ASAP, for yourself OR your Children.

Author: 25 April 2004
Review: Up there with The Nightmare Before Christmas and Toy Story.
Review_Url: When I originally saw the poster for this film (big empty space with a single fish), I instantly wanted to watch it, as I thought it was just beautiful. However, then I saw the trailers, and thought it just looked like a typical cutesy disney kids film.

Author: 14 June 2003
Review: A fantastic movie, about a little fish called Nemo who is swept into adventures above and under the sea!
Review_Url: A fantastic movie, about a little fish called Nemo who is swept into adventures above and under the sea! Nemo is the only remaining fish after his brothers, sisters, and mother have a dreadful experience with a shark. His father becomes overprotective of Nemo especially after Nemo is taken by a scubadiver and placed in a fish tank at a dentist's office. While wildly searching for Nemo, his father meets a comedic fish who suffers from short term memory loss. The two have adventures under the sea and meet an oceanful of fun!

Author: 5 June 2003
Review: Amazing Animation, Colorful Characters, Terrific Tale!
Review_Url: I have always been a Big fan of animated films, ex. Alladin, Beauty and The Beast, Toy Story, etc.  Yet, I have felt of late the animated pictures have been lacking the depth in story and the beauty in animation that they once held.  Finding Nemo has truly, in my opinion, found those elements again. I was greatly entertained with the films intriguing characters and profound plot.  True it is just a cartoon but it was better than your average cartoon:  It relayed the message of letting go. Many people know from experience what it is like to loose a loved one and how that loss effects how a person lives his or her life.  Finding Nemo relayed this concept in a very gentle and truthful way.  A+ Well done Pixar and Disney.  Thanks for going back to the good Days.

Author: 3 June 2003
Review_Url: I think that this film was beautifully done. The voice talents were perfect for their characters. I think that Helen DeGeneres deserves special mention for her zany character. I'd like to know how much of what she said she made up and how much was scripted. If it was all scripted, she's a genius because her lines sound absolutely spontaneous. The animation was poignant and extremely accurate. It shows that these guys did their marine life homework before making this film. The story is (as most are) an old one of growing up and letting go but I am particularly grateful to the writers for not putting too many fight/nagging scenes as most movies/TV programs do when they use this type of plot. Why they decided for the story to take place in Australia I have no idea but hey, why not? This is truly a universally appealing movie that would be good for anyone to see.

Author: 19 July 2004
Review: Not up to Pixar's usual standard?
Review_Url: I finally got around to seeing this on DVD. I was looking forward to it, but I was rather disappointed - compared to Pixar's other work. I don't know how it could be rated higher than either of the Toy story's.

Author: 16 April 2005
Review: Cruelest beginning for a kids' movie . . .
Review_Url: Okay, if you don't want to know anything about the beginning of the movie, stop reading. *** Our movie begins with idyllic life on the reef. We find two clownfish, Marlin (Albert Brooks) and Coral (Elizabeth Perkins) enjoying their new home (a sea anemone). He's concerned it's not big enough, she says it will be just fine, and they check on their 500 children, which are quivering fish fetuses in translucent fish eggs. Ah, how nice, how cute! Suddenly though, out of nowhere, a barracuda shows up and attacks the home. Marlin does the best he can, telling Coral to hide inside the anemone; however, Coral's concerned about the "kids" and goes to save them. The barracuda then swats Marlin unconscious into the protective tendrils of his home, and everything fades to black. When Marlin comes to, Coral has disappeared (we assume she's become dinner) and every single one of the eggs has been either destroyed or eaten except for one -- Nemo.

Author: 14 June 2003
Review_Url: Rarely have I actually laughed out loud in a movie theater 6 times. Probably the best comedy since, Monty Python and the Holy Grail.  The jokes were good for both adults and kids.  The second best thing may be that the plot was not just a pretense it actually was nice.

Author: 20 July 2003
Review_Url: After seeing a brief trailer for this on the Monsters Inc dvd,I couldnt wait to see this movie.But I was shocked to find out we wouldnt be getting a release in the UK until October.Luckily for me I had a trip to New York planned so I made sure a visit to the movies was planned.All I could say is wow,it lives up to Pixars high standards and it got a big thumbs up from my eight year old son.Everything from the characters to the animation is nothing short of spectacular,I will certainly be paying another visit to the movies again in October when it is released here.It is just a shame they couldnt have released it here for the summer.But as the saying goes all good things come to those who wait.UNMISSABLE

Author: 16 December 2003
Review_Url: Well my favorite Disney film still is Lilo & Stitch but this one is truly going second!

Author: 9 January 2004
Review_Url: I liked everything about this film. To me it has the important message that a parent would do anything for their child,which is important considering there's so much turmoil going on in the world today. Finding Nemo is a very entertaining film for all ages......looks like Disney and Pixtar did it once again!

Author: 5 July 2004
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is a very funny movie!I absolutely loved it.The story follows a father who is overprotective of his son.On the first day of school, Marlin(father) believes that his son,Nemo, is not yet ready for school ,but Nemo thinks otherwise and swims in to open sea and gets fishnapped and Marlin goes in search of him.On the way, he meets a fish with short-term memory loss named Dory and she helps him look for his son.

Author: 9 July 2004
Review: Pixar has done a good job..
Review_Url: Finding nemo is not the best film that Disney has ever created, however it can be said that it's very good. I've watched 3 times.. The events in the movie are easily estimated while we are watching. There is not so much surprises but the humor and the characters are fantastic. The kid turtles and vegetarian sharks are very nice.. The story is around a little crown fish which is kidnapped by the people who are living in Sydney.. His father wants to find him and there are humorous events while searching.. The colors are so vivid and the atmosphere of the ocean is very well designated.. I recommend the film but not strongly, It's nice but not perfect.. It can attract the children and it's a family name.

Author: 4 August 2003
Review_Url: Pixar  has created a  visually stunning animated movie. I could spend all day staring at this great animated aquarium that "Nemo" has delivered. Nemo with its great animation is worth seeing!  but only seeing.  the fact than many people are calling this a classic  makes me wonder what movie they saw.  What makes a classic animated movie  is  a good story  and strong characters.  I believe Nemo fails on both counts.  The story line is a basic one.  We follow the path of two fish, nemo and his father marlin  as they get seperated and their attempt to reunite.   The scenes depicted are nicely done  but you feel like you are being swept from one scene to another, the segways are missing. The story line is not deep enough so you can walk away feeling that you missed something in the storyline,  which in fact you haven't, there just isn't anything else there.   The film is also missing out on strong characters. The main characters would all be considered good supporting charcters,  but unfortunately  are asked to carry the  movie. But in their defense how much character can a fish have?  The point being is that finding nemo is a  beautifully animated film about fish  delivering a bunch of comedic lines  telling a simple story  that makes you want more than it delivers.   To me a classic delivers more than you want.

Author: 13 January 2004
Review_Url: I really can't describe my distaste for a children's movie in which you have to skip the entire first scene so as not to give the children nightmares. It really wasn't necessary to SHOW how Nemo and his father came to be alone. The animation is superb, but I expected, after all the build-up I'd read and heard, to hear a lot more laughter from the children watching it. This flick can't hold a candle to "Monsters, Inc."

Author: 2 June 2003
Review_Url: This movie was full of great characters but I was disappointed that it was one non-stop stressful scene after another.  My four year old was traumatized.   You couldn't even sit back and enjoy the fantastic comedy because the main characters were on the verge of death in practically every scene.   What's with all the murdered/dead parent themes in Disney movies anyway?  Monsters Inc. and Bug's Life both had much better balances of funny scenes and exciting/scary scenes.

Author: 30 May 2003
Review_Url: This is one of the best movies I've seen in such a long time. I laughed,my 15 year old laughed, my 12 year old laughed, and my 8 year old laughed!We were still laughing when we got home. There was nothing rude in it. It was good clean fun!A MUST see!!!

Author: 11 June 2003
Review_Url: I love the Toy Story movies and enjoyed Monsters Inc., so I was looking forward to Finding Nemo. Unfortunately, Nemo was not nearly as enjoyable as Pixar's other fine movies.

Author: 5 May 2015
Review_Url: "Finding Nemo," is an excellent movie for viewers of all ages. In this movie, three valuable life lessons are shared: 1) parents protect their children because they love and care for them, 2) teamwork is important in being successful, and 3) your differences do not define you. These lessons can apply to viewers of all ages and are presented throughout the course of the movie.

Author: 16 April 2006
Review_Url: what a great film. i went to see it with my two girls and we had the best of times. Scary, interesting, full of adventure, intelligent, hopeful, and everything i didn't mention. I loved it and my kids loved it!! Every once in a while Hollywood does produce a good think, especially for kids. When I was young it was snowithe. I remember how great that film was and I felt my girls were having the same experience as i did 30 years earlier. I wish Hollywood wasn't so much about stupidity; rather produce something that is good for the whole humanity and for the kids. I'd give it a 10 just because it has an educational value to it!

Author: 27 June 2006
Review_Url: What can I say about this movie? One word - Brilliant. Pixar have had a long track record of having yet to make anything less than a very good film but even though its almost unanimously agreed that all of them have been great, it seems everyone still has their preferences. To give you an idea of my taste I just adore "A Bug's Life" which I think is pretty much a pitch perfect movie with great characters and story. I enjoyed "Toy Story" but wasn't a huge fan of it, the sequel however is an absolute classic hands down. After 'Bugs' and 'TS2' though came "Monsters Inc" which again was a really good movie but I wasn't a huge fan of as the "Where the Wild Things Are"-cloned concept was fine but like TS1 the film got too juvenile and sentimentally sweet for me with the humor just worth the odd giggle more than anything else and only the awesome 'doors' sequence standing out in my mind.

Author: 12 July 2006
Review: The Best Piece of Disney and Pixar
Review_Url: I LOVED THIS MOVIE! You like coke? This movie will make you love water!! The friendly (or not) expressions from the characters, the funny and perfectly matched voices, the story, the idea, and everything is awesome! The soundtrack is what I like the most, maybe. Thomas Newman is for me an inspiration and my distractor (for good) on every occasion! The Ending song makes me wanna cry... And every moment of this movie is preceded by his music, which creates a natural, exotic, and beautiful climate.

Author: 19 July 2006
Review_Url: The latest in a string of tightly written and superbly animated features from Pixar Studios, who have risen to become gods of animation. Finding Nemo begins with one of the darkest openings in Disney cartoon history, telling the story of a father clown-fish named Merlin who loses his wife and all but one of his hundreds of fish eggs in a tragedy destined to make you think twice about ordering fish and chips for dinner. Marlin becomes the over-protective father of Nemo, his sole surviving child who is kidnapped by a scuba diving dentist and placed in a fish tank in his operating room. Thus the search begins, and Marlin must travel through the Great Barrier Reef to rescue his son, conquering his fears and meeting all sorts of strange and interesting creatures on the way (Bruce, a shark battling a ravishing fish addiction, is particularly memorable) The story thrives on simplicity, riding a singular concept all the way to a gloriously satisfying conclusion, and the script is choc-a-block full of gags and one-liners that are genuinely funny for all ages. This, in fact, is the perfect family movie: gorgeous to look at, tightly wound and high-octane, without a trace of pretension or dumb-downed ideals that so frequently condescend the younger market. Finding Nemo is one of the best animated films ever made, a glorious awe-inspiring tale comparable to classics like The Lion King.

Author: 20 July 2006
Review_Url: I never thought I would rave about a movie about fish. Actually, this story is about much more than that. It is about family and love and a tender relationship between a father and a son. I am not going to lie. At the end of this movie, I really teared up and almost cried. This movie was very heartfelt and it's definitely, without a doubt, the funniest movie I have seen this year.

Author: 22 July 2006
Review_Url: Finding Nemo contains a message slightly more complex than usually associated with family films, but as written and co-directed by Andrew Stanton, it's eloquently presented in a context that carries it through with potency. Stanton doesn't shy away from trauma -- the film contains its share, including an opening tragedy that rivals the shooting of Bambi's mother, but also pays respect to the precarious and predatory nature of undersea life. Everything is part of the food chain in the nautical world. It's the best circle of life message since Disney's The Lion King.

Author: 2 December 2019
Review_Url: I enjoyed this movie very much. I selected it for a movie review in high school and watched it more than 5 times in a row. The ultimate mix, sadness and joy, as usual in Disney movies was certenly included this time.

Author: 24 July 2006
Review_Url: I'm always consistently amazed at what Pixar is able to do. With each passing film, they improve their craft again and again, transporting us to worlds where toys talk, insects can make inventions, and where monsters live and work just like we do. With their latest release, "Finding Nemo," I am reminded once again why I love going to the movies.

Author: 6 November 2003
Review_Url: First off: the animation work is excellent. From a technical perspective this is a fine movie. It also has a few truly funny moments (sharks) and fairly decent voice-acting..

Author: 12 February 2023
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is the best underwater animated film of all time and it will remain that way for a while. Nemo especially of all Pixar films does not shy away from the randomness and brutality of nature. Right from the get go Marlins entire family, including his partner are eaten...That's probably the darkest scene of any Pixar Studios film. Nature is brutal and so is survival. For kids movie it is a very empowering and sad scene.

Author: 30 May 2003
Review_Url: Yeah Pixar! Rock it! You're 5 for 5 and have never made a bad movie. Not many people can say that... enjoy it! Stick it to Disney when you get your chance! Excellent voice work all around.. Albert Brooks may have been a little wasted but Ellen more than made up for it. Oh and I'm sick of all the whining about her being cast in the movie. She's a comedian. She's paid to be funny. She is funny. Nemo is a funnier movie because of her. Quit it! Let the woman do her job. Should Disneyworld start refusing to hire gay people? Come on!

Author: 4 June 2003
Review: Pixar took me me a swim
Review_Url: First and foremost, this is the most unbelievably and wickedly real! I just can't believe Pixar has successfully made me feel I'm 'in' the oceans with the rest of the millions and billions of fishes! The animations were flawlessly realistic. Everything shown was superb! I will most definitely recommend this movie to friends/people! trust me, it's worthwhile!

Author: 10 September 2003
Review: Will be regarded as a modern day classic
Review_Url: Isn't it great that in these times of war, terror and fear that there is a company like PIXAR, who can produce wonderful, entertaining and intelligent movies. Finding Nemo is their best work yet, but I say that after each of their movies( Toy Stories 1 & II, Monsters INC etc). To achieve such magical effects is a wonderous feat, but to combine this with a magnificent script and to have such brilliant character actors such as Albert Brooks, Ellen Degeneres, and Geoffrey Rush, to name a few, justs tops it off for me. Remember the Wizard of Oz?..... I believe that in many Years to come, when we are long gone.... Finding Nemo will be referred to in the same way... a magical movie classic!

Author: 23 October 2003
Review: Grab Shell for the ride of your life!
Review_Url: If you haven't seen this movie get down to the cinema before you miss out on the best film of all time! It is without a doubt the sweetest, funniest, most exciting film I (and many others) have seen in years! The backgrounds are beautiful and so life-like! And I can barely find words to describe the characters. They are superbly animated and are brought to life by some extremly talented actors. If (and I very much doubt it) you aren't sure of the plot, here's an insight to it: After the death of his wife and 399 children, Marlin the Clownfish becomes over-protective of his only surviving son, Nemo. When Nemo gets tired of his fathers protectiveness, he abandons the safety of his home and ends up being captured by an Austrailian diver. Nemo then finds himself in the company of the 'Tank Gang' in a dentists office tank. Meanwhile, Marlin desperatly tries to find his son, with the help of the memory-losing, optimistic and Danger-Prone Dory, a Regal Blue Tang fish. Together they encouter vegitarian sharks, a forest of Jellyfish, the EAC-surfing turtles and many more colourful characters in this story about the seas most dedicated father, Marlin and the funniest fish in the world, Dory. I am positive that any Disney-Pixar, fish or touching-movie fan will not be able to resist the brilliance of this film. Treat yourself to Disney-Pixars Greatest acheivement, Finding Nemo! 10/10! Jenny xxx

Author: 18 July 2003
Review_Url: This has to be one of the best animated movies ever!  It was funny, exiting, well animated, and suitable for all age groups (well, really young ones might find it a bit scary).  The animation was unbelievable - there were scenes that could have been straight out of a photograph, if things weren't moving in it.  Of course, the characters don't look that realistic, but they are still very well animated, I was impressed as usual by Pixar's talent. I thought the acting was great, the characters were very well done, and the dentist scenes were just funny beyond belief.  And the sea turtles.  I usually don't like Disney movies, but this one takes the cake.

Author: 31 May 2003
Review: So cute, and so much fun!
Review_Url: What a cute movie! I saw the previews for it and I was excited, but I wondered how many other people in their early 20's would be excited to see a little fish movie. But tonight the theater was packed with people of all ages. I laughed so hard and was very entertained. The voices were great [Ellen DeGeneres was awesome!] and the special effects were very impressive. I can't wait to buy the DVD! :) A definite must-see: 10/10.

Author: 8 July 2003
Review_Url: it was ok to me.it was worth going to see but i think that only little kids and adults will enjoy this movie.I am 13 so it wasnt the coolest movie in the world to me.It is a movie i would buy for my little brother who is 3.my favorite charecter was Gill, voiced by willem dafoe.Who i think is a great actor.i would not recommend this to teens.only to little kids and maybe adults.

Author: 24 June 2003
Review: The best movie from Pixar to date
Review_Url: Finding Nemo was the best movie produced at Pixar studios to date. I am so glad this company didn't go under. this movie had enough of everything to keep you interested the entire time. Bruce was my favorite character, but only by a little over Crush.

Author: 16 July 2016
Review: Great animation, great characters, great movie indeed.
Review_Url: Pixal most often presents us their great animated feature films and 'Finding Nemo' is no exception, rather is one of the best movies by them. Being one of a huge fan of animated movies myself, I certainly have enjoyed watching every second of the movie. The stunning animation, flawless story-line, and amusing humor will hardly make anyone not love the movie.

Author: 11 September 2003
Review_Url: I think this movie is the best movie i've seen in the whole year. I really like the animation and the story.. even though a lot of people said it's for kids but i think there something deep and meaningful about the whole thing. I love the character Dory.. so funny.. Anyway I think it's a very good family movie like other Pixar movie. I love it so much that i can say that people who said that it's a stupid pointless movie are stupid themselves.

Author: 10 December 2003
Review_Url: You'd be better off watching Toy Story in the animation category than this, which is a beautiful piece of computer animation, but bland in terms of dialogue particularly.  It's actually rather annoying.  And it lacks humor in my opinion.

Author: 28 March 2004
Review_Url: Wow, this movie was the best animated film I've ever seen in my life. The animation was excellent, the voices were very energetic, and the characters were hilarious! There was Marlin, who is way too overprotective, there was Dory, who has short-term memory loss, and there were so many funny fish in that movie. The story is charming with some humorous parts. I correct myself: it was all funny! While I don't understand why it couldn't talk, the deep-sea anglerfish actually did scare some people. I think everything was exactly how the directors wanted it and if it wasn't, it turned out excellent anyways. I think that whoever hasn't seen this film should see it immediately!

Author: 10 March 2018
Review: Adventurous, fun, emotional and narratively perfect.
Review_Url: When I was younger, and I watched this movie numerous times, I understood that it was one of those few animated films that made me feel immersed in an adventurous world, full of characteristics close to human. All this through a story of ... FISH.

Author: 22 December 2004
Review: This movie really blows everything out of the water!
Review_Url: This Pixar film, I believe, really gone and done it. I truly think they made a 101% job on Finding Nemo. It's funny for all ages, it's emotional, the morals spill out plain to see, it's adventurous, the film is top notch state of the art, and it's original. It really inspired me, and I've been coming up with stories all my life. I never thought to create a story about fish parenting in the ocean. I personally think it's so good that all animation movies should be compared to Finding Nemo before and after release. It was a top box hit, and full of extras as well. Pixar is really reeling in the cash. It was a jackpot of a film, and it will be extremely hard to make another film that will size up to it or even beat Finding Nemo. Of course with tomorrows technology I could see that happening in the next few years. Go see it if for some reason you haven't already.

Author: 16 May 2017
Review_Url: Wow Finding Nemo is a great film for kids and adults. The characters are great! Definitely Dory!. I find that this movie has quite a few dark scenes especially the shark can be quite scary to younger kids. Nemo ends up in the tank gang who are all wonderful characters. The colours and animation were a perfect match to this film.

Author: 27 May 2019
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is a pleasant, fun, and yet very touching film about a father and son. The animation still looks wonderful many years later and is a great addition to Pixar's lineup of films.

Author: 1 June 2003
Review_Url: I saw this movie on the opening night with my daughter and nephew (both 3-year-olds), and I found that I was shushing them more so I could hear the movie rather than worrying about others hearing them. This is the funniest animated film I have seen since Toy Story. It's definitely worth seeing. You'll be laughing the whole way through the film!

Author: 24 October 2003
Review_Url: I have to admit that I expected to be bowled over by this film, but although it was gorgeous to look at and quite amusing from time to time, it never really gripped me. I didn't really feel any great tension or emotion, despite the fact that I took my young son, who also had just started school. In fact he was even less thrilled with it than I was, as 10 minutes from the end he wanted to leave and I had to persuade him to stay to the end. No surprise then that his preferred animated films are still Shrek, Monsters Inc and A Bug's Life.

Author: 3 August 2003
Review_Url: Since it was hard to imagine Pixar ever topping its original Toy Story, and upon first learning on who was going to provide the voices of the characters, I was not enthusiastic about Finding Nemo. None of the other Pixar releases (Bug's Life, Toy Story 2, Monsters Inc.) quite measured up to the original Toy Story, so I had reduced Nemo to rental status. It took a sold out show of Pirates of the Caribbean to make me experience one of the most enjoyable movies I have had the pleasure of watching on the big screen. There are movies that can be enjoyed equally on the theaters or at home, and there are others that you just have to shell out the 8 or so dollars and watch it on theater, and Finding Nemo is definitely one of the latter.

Author: 1 June 2003
Review: 10 Stars. More clever than Toy Story & Monsters, Inc.
Review_Url: Played to a packed Saturday matinee. Audience applauded at end. Clever, fun and entertaining, with few slow spots in the plot, our adults and kids enjoyed Finding Nemo very much. We guessed that Disney/Pixar was going to release this in Early December 2003 for Christmas Video/DVD sales - and it will be one of the hottest gift items for Xmas 2003.

Author: 26 October 2003
Review_Url: Finding Nemo was one of the best movies I have seen in a long time. It is right up there, as far as I am concerned with Shrek, Monsters Inc., and Ice Age. Being a biology student at St. FX university, I found the little science related jokes to be great "... with fronds like these who need anenomes?".  I highly recommend this movie, it had a great story and had many funny moments throughout.

Author: 19 July 2003
Review_Url: Words cannot begin to describe the visual graphic details of this movie. The lush backdrop of the ocean combined with the vivid colors of the characters makes this a treat for the eyes.

Author: 29 June 2003
Review: Another world (and, finally, the movie that gets us there)
Review_Url: I think that some of the more recent box-office successes have been attractive because they have been able to transport people out of this hectic world into some other place.  These movies, such as the original Star Wars Trilogy, the first Matrix movie, The Lord of the Rings, and others, have created this escape in enough depth and detail such that the viewer feels fully removed from their actual surroundings.

Author: 7 April 2006
Review_Url: Disney didn't seem to be delivering the goods like they used to until Nemo came along and boy was he worth the wait. I never thought the clown fish can be so sweet. Finding Nemo is a great family film enjoyed by all. When watching it you'll find that at least two people will come out trying to speak whale or quoting 'Fish are friend, not Food' but that's what makes the film so great and memorable. If you have not seen the film yet - Where have you been? You'll fall completely in love with all of the characters and insist that you buy your own aquarium for your own Nemo cast. I hope that Disney's next project is a good as 'Finding Nemo' - Good Luck.

Author: 13 January 2020
Review_Url: One of the greatest movies of all time. It's hard to find someone who did not watch this iconic feature

Author: 21 July 2006
Review_Url: It's been seven years since Pixar unleashed Toy Story 2, the first full-length computer animated feature film, on the world, and what a wild, whimsical ride it was. Working in tandem with Disney (an association perilously close to ending), Pixar has provided several equally wondrous rides -- Toy Story 2, A Bug's Life, Monsters Inc., all of which contained themes and characters perfectly suited to the hyper-realistic computer-generated style of animation. Pixar's films feature carefully crafted narratives, simple but not simplistic, offering an ebb and flow of action-stoked set pieces that, at best, stoke our adrenaline while keeping our funny bones on vibrating overdrive.

Author: 25 July 2006
Review: The Best Animated Film of All Time
Review_Url: This 2003 triumph from Pixar - the outfit that gave us both "Toy Story" movies and "MonSters, Inc." - has a more emotionally substantial story than its predecessors, set against stunningly beautiful backgrounds that set a new high-water mark in the digital art form, surpassing even "Shrek," produced by Pixar's arch-rivals at PDI. This film proves Pixar reigns as the finest storytellers in family film. To create a grand odyssey for two lovable underdogs, the Pixar team mixes playfulness, a deep love of film, and a visual beauty that is unmatched in the industry. This is not just a great animated movie  it is a superior film, period.

Author: 30 May 2003
Review_Url: Yes, it was THAT good!

Author: 11 August 2006
Review_Url: Finding new life in the old fish-story, Finding Nemo is another fine computer animated offering from the people at Pixar, just as family-oriented as their last offerings, and just as adventure and humor-filled as ever. The animation and backgrounds are superb; it's often a remarkable achievement, and the colorful scenes of marine life and reefs makes it a visual treat. Though the film takes a little while to get going, after a truly heart-wrenching tragic beginning (at least for an animated film), once the search for Nemo starts, it's a non-stop quest with one clever thing after another. In fact, much like its previous siblings, the script is full of amusing situations (such as the chaotic climax at the dentist's office), clever dialogue, and humorous finds. It's also packed to the gills (pun intended) with eccentric characters, such as a trio of sharks trying to kick the habit of eating other fish, a pack of surfer-dude sea turtles, and some dim-witted birds. But the funniest bits are, of course, the myriad of dangers the poor fish must face, from a sea of jellyfish, to the threat of predators, to being swallowed up by a whale. The voice actors, from the neurotic Brooks to the spacey DeGeneres, are all terrific, and well chosen.

Author: 17 October 2021
Review_Url: I was a big Finding Nemo fan. I should watch it again as an adult, but almost 20 years ago I was in love with this movie and watched it multiple times!

Author: 27 December 2020
Review_Url: A film with joy, curiosity and excitement. swim with sharks and be inside a whale, it's quite a trip. it is a movie I can definitely recommend.

Author: 24 June 2003
Review_Url: What needs to be said? Pixar hasn't made one bad movie yet. Every Pixar movie is an instant classic, and this is no exception. I can hardly wait for the DVD to come out so I can watch the bloopers and all the extras.

Author: 3 June 2003
Review_Url: This is a great movie for people of all ages. We took the kids, but I'm going back on my own for a second time. Ellen DeGeneres is absolutely flawless and endearing.

Author: 19 November 2004
Review: Heartwarming and beautifully animated, Finding Nemo is one of the best movies out there
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is, as far as I know, the first animated movie that has real value for adults as well as kids. And not in the way that most kid films do, that are merely bearable and faintly amusing at best to anyone above the age of 14. Finding Nemo has a couple of essentials for all age groups: for kids, there is the moral of the story, the cute and funny characters (think the albatros and the turtle), and of course the happy ending. For adolescents and grown-ups, there are contemporary movie references, and more 'grown-up' jokes that might be hard to grasp for little kids. The amazing animation is always a huge added bonus for anyone who really pays attention to the movie, and would be worth going to the movies for even if the story was only so-so and the dialogue boring.

Author: 19 August 2008
Review: Beautiful animation and Ellen is hilarious
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is a beautiful work of art. Ellen DeGeneres as Dory is fantastic in this film. The first time I heard Ellen's comedy was a routine that was played on an airplane about bad milk. She has such an interesting, quirky way of looking at the world and the writers of Finding Nemo captured that perfectly in the Dory's character. The animation is gorgeous. The color of the water and the way it changes as the characters swim through it is beautiful. Director Andrew Stanton is hilarious as Crush. What a talented guy. This movie has a great message for parents on good child-rearing and about taking chances and living even when life gives you a a setback like a tiny flipper.

Author: 17 September 2003
Review: Best film of the summer- maybe of the year....
Review_Url: I saw this movie and was totally blown away. The previews looked good, so I figured the movie would be decent. But I was not prepared at all for how incredibly the movie drew everyone in. When I saw it, it wasn't with an enormous amount of little kids, but with people of all ages- 3 to 75. The voice acting is some of the best  ever- especially Ellen DeGeneres. The character of Dory was taken to a whole other level by the quality of Ellen's voice work- you couldn't help but laugh hysterically at almost everything she said. However, she also proved she could do more than just comedy- I don't know how anyone cannot get the slightest bit misty when she says "I look at you, and....and I'm home..."  Other great voices by Albert Brooks (Marlin), Allison Janney (Peach), Willem Dafoe (Gil), Alexander Gould (Nemo) and Brad Garrett (Brother Blow) make this movie one of the funniest and feel good films I've seen in a long time. A shoo in for Best Animated Feature at the Oscars this year, and I can even see a nod for Best Picture.

Author: 19 July 2003
Review: Best animated movie I have ever seen- definitely worth seeing for anyone
Review_Url: I don't usually see animated movies in the theater, and when I do, I never see them a second time, except on video. However, this was the first exception. This immediately became my favorite animated movie, and I actually decided to go back and see it a second time. None of my friends who I saw it with the first time wanted to go back so I went with some others who hadn't yet seen it.

Author: 13 June 2003
Review_Url: I thought the movie was pleasant--I got a couple of chuckles.  I love the Toy Story movies, Shrek, Bug's Life, so with all the great reviews I was primed for a real laugher.  I just didn't laugh, though.  The whale talk got stale--fast, the 12 step shark program wasn't that funny.  I liked the seagulls, and I liked the Psycho reference.  Finally, I thought the most striking thing was that Marlin (the father) was the one expected to mature and let Nemo go.  Yet, if Nemo had listened to his father in the first place, he wouldn't have had to be found.

Author: 19 February 2005
Review_Url: I would estimate...about 97% of the movie going world loved this movie.

Author: 21 January 2021
Review_Url: Beside having excellent animation this movie seems to have a great research on ocean life. No it didnt seem national Geo program, it was all put in excellent story, animation, adventure and comedy. Loved watchin it

Author: 22 June 2003
Review_Url: Visuals were decent, but its nothing ground-breaking.  It doesn't make me go, "WOW" like toy story or monsters INC.  IMO monsters INC was more brilliant and a better movie, toy story 1 and 2 were better also. Finding Nemo was just really plain.  The ocean got really boring after a while, and the voice for Marlin the overprotective father was really annoying also.  He was shouting the whole movie, it just got really old. I felt disconnected and bored many times in the movie theatre.

Author: 18 June 2003
Review_Url: I love these movies and Finding Nemo is incredible.

Author: 26 October 2003
Review_Url: A great animation! Pixar studios made one of their best films. The story of the film is interesting and thrilling, showing us a true love between father and son, despite the fact that they are clown-fishes. Many awesome jokes in the script, too. The genre's fans should watch it at all cost, I gave it 9/10.

Author: 23 January 2004
Review_Url: This movie was exceptionally cute and appropriate for ALL ages!   We have a little girl who isn't even 1 year old yet, and we watched it with her and even she reacts and smiles and laughs at it and enjoys the colors and funny characters.   It has humor for all ages, as well.  Definitely a classic Disney/Pixar movie.

Author: 9 July 2022
Review_Url: This was one of the most successful Disney films at the cinema to date. It is the underwater story of a young clown fish named Nemo (Alexander Gould) taken by divers and put into a tank. The idea is obviously his Dad, Marlin (Albert Brooks), and new friend Dory (Ellen DeGeneres), who has short-term memory loss, are "finding" him. Meanwhile, Nemo along with new friends including fishes Gill (Willem Dafoe), Bloat (Brad Garrett), Peach (Allison Janney), Gurgle (Austin Pendleton), Bubbles (Stephen Root), Deb/Flo (Vicki Lewis), Jacques (Joe Ranft) and pelican Nigel (Geoffrey Rush) are trying to escape. Along the journey Marland and Dory encounter three sharks, including Bruce (Barry Humphries, aka Dame Edna Everage) (named after the rubber Shark in the Jaws series), stinging jellyfish, turtles in a current tunnel, including "dude" Crush (Andrew Stanton) and much more, but he finds him eventually, and everything's fine. Also starring Big's Elizabeth Perkins as Coral, Nicholas Bird as Squirt, Bob Peterson as Mr. Ray, Eric Bana as Anchor, and Toy Story's John Ratzenberger as Fish School. It won the Oscar for Best Animated Feature, and it was nominated for Best Music, Original Score for Thomas Newman, Best Sound Editing, and Best Writing, Original Screenplay, it was nominated the BAFTA for Best Original Screenplay, and it was nominated the Golden Globe for Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy. It was number 13 on The 100 Greatest Family Films.

Author: 5 September 2004
Review_Url: I hated this movie!! It was awful!! I wish I woulda saved my money so now I

Author: 3 August 2003
Review_Url: First of all, let me tell you that I am not someone who just  hates all animated movies. Infact I love The Lion King, and recently the only good Disney animated movies are the one's Pixar has made, so I have nothing against Pixar. Both Toy Story and Toy Story 2 are great movies,(especially the first one), and A Bug's Life and Monsters Inc. are definitly a cut above the modern animated movie, but I have to say with disappointment that Finding Nemo is not anywhere near those good movies. Let me start with my biggest complaint, TOO MUCH ACTION! This movie had way too much action for an animated movie. Animated movies aren't about action, but I guess the filmmakers of this movie didn't know that. While I don't mind some action sequences in an animated movie,( like the antalope stampede in Lion King), the action sequences in this movie get a little redundent. I guess the animators are tring to "wow" you with the animation, and maybe that would of worked if this was the first movie of it's kind, but now that a lot of these type of movies have come out it's just boring. So then you may ask, what are animated movies about? Two things, laughter and fun, which this film is lacking in. While the other Pixar movies have fun jokes for kids and intelligent jokes for adults this film has none. Sure there maybe a few smart jokes about aquatic creatures in the beginning, but most of the time there is an oppertunity for a joke, they start an action sequence. In my opion, Finding Nemo is probably the most over rated animated movie of all-time.

Author: 18 March 2013
Review_Url: I love this movie so much. It's the best ever! It probably is my favorite movie of all time. So adorable, beautiful, and incomparable. I'm happy for Finding Nemo 2 even though The Incredibles is the only Pixar movie needing a part 2. I hope Finding Nemo 2 is as good or even better than Finding Nemo 1, although Pixar needs to make a part 2 for the movies really needing them, and it only appears that The Incredibles needs it because we didn't get to know what happened after the ending of The Incredibles since that movie did not have a perfectly happy ending. However, back to Finding Nemo, it is such a great movie. I always will love it. Best movie ever made!

Author: 23 April 2005
Review_Url: I would like to congratulate Pixar studio for this movie, especially because story is so weak and has almost nothing in it. All the other Pixar movies before this had superb stories and now the trick was how did they made it click even then?

Author: 23 September 2007
Review_Url: This is a great movie filled with beautiful visuals, wonderful voices, and a story that mimics life so heavily that I don't even think people can grasp it. Here you have Nemo, a fish who has a visible handicap (but not handicapping condition). His father, who lost his mate and whole brood (minus Nemo) wants to protect him with everything he has in him, yet Nemo just wants to be like everyone else and do what the other kids are doing. In the process of showing everyone what he can do by swimming further out over the drop than the other fish, he gets scooped up by a scuba diver and all of his father's nightmares come true: he's lost his only son.

Author: 3 August 2017
Review_Url: Great movie for kids and family. I was really nervous will Nemo find a way back home, but he did. I am very happy to watch this great movie again with friends. Pixar always make such a great movies. And this animation is something different. The amazing story in the sea. Dory is absolutely my favorite. So glad to watch finding Dory too. :)

Author: 30 April 2020
Review_Url: Grew up watching this, I would watch it a lot, named my first pet after Nemo's dad. I have too much positive association with this film to rate it anything less.

Author: 10 August 2016
Review: one of the best animated movies
Review_Url: "Finding Nemo" is one of the best animated movies I've ever seen and one of the best Disney-Pixar movies. It's an amazing movie for the whole family. It's funny, colorful and ideal for both children and adults. With brilliant characters (like Dory),funny lines, unforgettable and captivating moments and scenes, "Finding Nemo" will never let you get bored.

Author: 1 March 2017
Review: This is a movie about 2 fish who travel through the sea together with many adventures.
Review_Url: This was a nice and funny movie for kids. I love all of the different adventures they had as they swam through the sea. I recommend this for many of the young age children! Nemo and Dory are a great match and are really good friends. Dory sometimes gets on Nemo's nerves but they still stay close and hang in there together through the good and hard times.

Author: 18 March 2017
Review: Lovely because it is about the bonding of sea and surface creatures
Review_Url: Wow! This is one of the my most loving movie. Cause it's about the fishes and creatures under the sea. Also about the bonding with the sea creatures with the surface creatures. The voices are cool. Dory, Nemo and Marlin. Nemo is so cute. and the most cutest is dory. Although dory's voice is given by Ellen. And the latest part of Finding Dory is also such a wonderful movie. The movie at least you can watch with your family peacefully and that contains no violence or sex.

Author: 2 December 2019
Review_Url: I remember watching Nemo as a kid, around 9 years old. I loved it then, and I love it now. My 3 children love it aswel. Such a timeless movie!

Author: 19 May 2006
Review_Url: As a 16 year old, i think of myself as still a child in many ways! My love of Disney Films being one of them. However, i find Finding Nemo is one of a dying breed... a Disney film which is actually good. OK, no matter what Disney films will always be here to delight children, but there are few Disney films being produced at the moment that seem to hold parents and children alike. Now it seems that a lot of the time Disney are just cashing in. EVERYTHING has a sequel! And none of the sequels are half as good as the original. I think the Pixar/Disney collaboration has been good. As i said, Finding Nemo is an amazing Disney film that has many of the memorable characters and witty lines that makes it a film sure to be remembered for years to come. I think Disney should stick to the new ideas for movies. New Stories. You don't need to make 7 Lion King movies or Aladdin movies for kids to still love the characters. The Land Before Time film from Universal was quite probably one of if not my favourite film when i was a kid. Now you look at Sky movies and they are showing Land Before Time IX and even more! So i say keep making stand alone films with the quality, care and thought that you put into Finding Nemo and you'll remain a success forever.

Author: 2 June 2003
Review_Url: While this movie is great and rated "G", be careful with the littlest ones, as there are some very exciting and scary scenes in it.  I spent some time in the lobby with my youngest(almost 3), although the other two were fine (5 and 7).

Author: 15 June 2003
Review_Url: I took my kids (aged 6 and 8)to see this movie this afternoon expecting to spend the next two hours bored at best.  At worst, my kids would be as bored as well and I'd be spending that time trying to keep them under control. Not a chance!!!  This movie was great--not only for the kids but for me as well!  At times, we could barely hear the movie over all the laughing going on in the theatre.  I can't wait for this one to come out on DVD.  I gave Toy Story an 9/10 but this one was even better.  A clear 10/10!!

Author: 1 April 2006
Review: Finding Nemo is a great family film!!!!
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is a great movie for not only kids, but parents will not mind watching it either. It's a great family film. Finding Nemo is a heart warming tale about a clown fish named Nemo who gets separated from his Father, Marlin and his classmates after Nemo gets captured by a scuba diver. Throughout the movie, Marlin desperately tries to find his son with the help of a lovable fish named Dory. Dory tries to help but has short-term memory loss. This characteristic of her brings a lot of laughs into the movie. As Marlin tries to find Nemo and travel to Australia, where Nemo is taken, he encounters Bruce the shark, Crush the turtle, and many other lovable sea creatures along the way. I will not spoil it for you so to find out the ending, you'll have to watch it for yourself. I highly recommend that you watch this movie!!!

Author: 13 March 2019
Review_Url: How are you suppose to find someone you care about, when there are so many fish in the sea? This question can be answered in the kids film, Finding Nemo by Disney Pixar. This adventurous film takes place in the ocean where the main characters are fish. The film really shows family issues and how it affects children of adolescence in a funny kids animation about a real serious issue. The fathers and sons relationship starts out edgy because of the issues in the family, but the father and the sons relationship starts to grow throughout the film. In the end there's almost always a solution to this, but nothing you would quite see in the film, Finding Nemo. When the film is done and over, you will see how this can affect a child and how there can be misunderstandings to every action. But in the end there's only one truth.

Author: 15 April 2006
Review_Url: I just watched "Finding Nemo" with my two-year-old son. (He wasn't even born when this movie came out, which is why I've never seen it until today). I really liked this film for a number of reasons. Not only was it very intense emotionally, but there was no point in the film was anything *bad* happening. There were no cheap innuendos, nothing but good clean fun. At the same time, it was never stupid or clownish (no pun intended). I would really like the creators of this film to know that I appreciated their work as being an effort in "using one's powers for good, not evil." In addition, I'm sure that people who have similar dilemmas in their family life: children with special needs, parents who are overprotective, or anyone with a loss or grief in their family, will feel especially attuned to this film. This is a great movie for either families or individuals.

Author: 25 April 2006
Review: "Finding Nemo" is a great example of the genius of the folks at Pixar.
Review_Url: I have always been a fan of animated movies and, starting with Toy Story, I've become increasingly impressed at what can be accomplished with computer animation. "Finding Nemo" is a great example of the genius of the folks at Pixar.

Author: 1 May 2006
Review_Url: Three years ago, Walt Disney Pictures and Pixar teamed up to release Finding Nemo to the masses. The hit children's underwater adventure video is an animated story based on a rebelliously independent young clownfish and his overprotective father's inability to let go. Enticed by a witty trailer and a captivating graphical design, Finding Nemo attracted a wide audience to the theatres. Digitally mastered and exquisitely written, Finding Nemo premiered May 3rd, 2003, as a G rated, light hearted, animated production geared towards children. The familiar voices of main characters, Dory (Ellen DeGeneres) and Marlin (Albert Brooks) teamed up in an encore partnership, returning from 1998's Dr. Dolittle. The hour and 44 minute presentation that brought over $300 million to the box office in its first week in the theatres. The script is a roller-coaster of friendly humor, written by Andrew Stanton and is sincerely thought provoking for Disney's adult viewers. Finding Nemo is sure to become a childhood classic. The opening scene is at Nemo's elementary school. Marlin, the widowed single parent, introduces Nemo to his teacher as a timid student, who requires extra attention for his special needs. Crowds will chuckle at the cynical humor, merciless mimicking students in the background and defining sarcastic gestures in this scene. Taunted by his peers, Nemo challenges his father, swimming farther and farther out into the abyss, towards a row boat at the surface. By the time Marlin catches his curiously disobedient son in the act, he swam far away from the group and was at the surface. The authors' creative expressiveness and ingenuity with the line "he touched the butt!" is innocent enough for six year olds to repeat, and at the same time harmlessly pokes fun at the daily trials parents face with young children. With the conscious lesson that every ill minded action has consequences, the row boat unexpectedly carries Nemo away from his home. Marlin enlists into a desperate rescue attempt for his beloved son and soon encounters Dory, the annoying travel companion with the funky problem of poor short term memory. In their travels, Marlin and Dory accidentally stumble upon two great white sharks. Instantly intrigued, Dory tries to make new friends, while Marlin backs off because of preconceived stereotypes about vicious great white sharks. As it turns out the two have joined to form an anti fish eating support group. With a membership pledge of "fish are friends, not food", Marlin and Dory escape a near death experience. In this fast paced scene that speaks to breaking stereotypes, adults will pick up on the parody on the politics of vegetarianism and a poke at "meaningless" support groups. Some of the content in this two minute scene may frighten younger viewers, as the loud noises, exploding mines and sharks with big scary teeth dominate the screen. Pressing on with the goal of finding his son in Sydney, Marlin and Dory ride the East Australian Current with a huge pack of sea turtles, and Marlin has a chance to tell his epic story. One of the elder turtles and an experienced parent, Crush (voice of Andrew Stanton) listens in, imparts some wisdom, and helps Marlin regain a firm a grasp on life. His advice, and the movie's main message, is that children are going to grow up and that part of successful parenting is letting them go and watching them. You have to know that you have done all you can for your children and that they have learned well. The climax of the movie is this scene, where Marlin realizes his error and finally begins to believe in his son. As the music tempo accelerates, the current quickens and the scene makes a dramatic switch back to a comedic tone, keeping children on the edge of their toes and leaving adults satisfied with the depth of content matter. Having arrived in Sydney, Marlin immediately jumps back into the search for his son. While the graphics change with the new on-land scenery, their impressive Pixar quality remains. New sounds from the city and music perfectly accompany every plot curve as the two fish face new challenges of human and bird interaction. A pelican named Nigel flies in to save the two fish from a particularly hungry flock of seagulls placing bids on their next meal, saying "Mine! Mine! Mine!" in their thick Australian brogue. The creative scripting is again paired with a hidden message of parenting that sometimes you need to take a risk and trust other people. Finding Nemo is a fantastic film, with much thought, enthusiasm and heart behind the plot, animation and message. Finding Nemo leaves Mom and Dad with a feeling of parental community in that they are not alone in their struggles with parenting. The innocent humor and narrative plot leaves children wanting to watch the movie several times over and quote their favorite lines with friends. The movie is appropriate for all children ages six and older and all adults who are young at heart. The underlying comedy and animation in this film hides a message that speaks of social issues, politics and parenting, which makes Finding Nemo a great movie for children and adults alike. Disney's Finding Nemo jumps a full step above Toy Story and does not even compare to the original classics like Cinderella, winning an Oscar Award and Best Animated Children's movie in the 2004 Academy Awards.

Author: 3 September 2019
Review_Url: I've always been a huge fan of animation but "Finding Nemo" has been, and will always be, my favorite animated film. I have yet to find another film as memorable or inspirational.

Author: 27 November 2019
Review_Url: We didn't see Nemo drown damnit, the mom dies in beginning best scene it's hilarious, and I thought we were building up to see Nemo die, but no...

Author: 23 March 2023
Review_Url: This is the very first movie i ever saw, at least in my conscious memory. It was 2004 maybe. My uncle took me and my little sis for a visit to one of his friend's place. They had a dvd player. And also a lot of animated films. They suggested that we should watch this new movie that they have bought. Before this i never watched a full length film in one sitting. I remember i watched finding nemo at one breath. Didnt loose my attention for one single frame. Point to note, english is not my first tongue. And at that age i didn't understand it well. But of course that didn't stop me from enjoying the film. I teared up at the end of it and that says something, i barely cry watching movies. This will forever be the best film for me.

Author: 8 November 2003
Review: Anybody who doesn't like this movie needs to learn to laugh!

A kind movie about a caring dad who can't believe that he will never see his son again, and is ready to do anything to save him. And again, the essence of the plot flashes in my head, how to get rid of the fears of the past, to live in the present.

Author: 10 September 2013
Review_Url: Finding Nemo was a very cute movie. It is about a father and son clown fish who one day get separated. Nemo is the son and Merlin is the father. Merlin goes all over the ocean looking for his son and meets up with a blue angel fish named Dory. Dory has a memory span of 5 to 10 seconds. Dory joins Merlin in the search for Nemo. It is an exciting and on the edge of your seat movie. Just when you think you have it figured out...you don't. First you will go whoa, then you'll go whoa, then you will go whoa... Watch and see just where Nemo ended up and how he gets back together with his father. Just remember "fish are friends NOT food."

It will definitely lift your spirits, and it's the best thing, I think, Pixar's done.

Author: 15 May 2009
Review: Quite possibly the BEST movie EVER
Review_Url: This movie is amazing! I watch it over and over again! Its beautiful! Its not like shark tale and spongebob, in which the fish live in cities with electricity-finding nemo is totally natural! The anemone, the barracuda, the anglerfish-all that! The color was amazing, too! They did exaggerate the colors a bit (like how deb and flo are blue and white striped with a blue tail while the species they are suppost to be are black and white striped with a white tail) and they, of course, drastically exaggerated the emotions fish can feel. They also made the fish a lot smarter than they really are. Overall, I think Finding Nemo is suburb and something every soul on earth should see, no matter how inland they live!

Review: Right up there with Toy Story and Toy Story 2; well-animated with a good plot.

Since the trailers had told us absolutely nothing about the movie, I actually assumed that Dory and Marlin were man and wife (or something); I questioned how a movie of any length could be carried entirely by a fish's search for his son. I must confess that my expectations were completely exceeded. I was blown away.

Author: 31 May 2003
Review_Url: This is the BEST movie from Pixar yet.  The story line was well thought out, and excellently executed.  I was worried that parts of the movie would be too intense.  However, the humor that infused the entire movie kept this from happening.  Finding Nemo is the best kind of comedy. Totally unlike so many comedies today, where you have a few really funny scenes connected by long periods of not funny.  My husband commented that this was the most continuously funny movie that he had seen in a long time.  I personally did not expect to like this movie.  I don't care for Albert Brooks, or Ellen DeGeneres, but the movie itself distracted me from who was doing the voices.

Author: 19 June 2011
Review_Url: Finding Nemo is an animated film created in 2003 about the father –son adventure through the mysterious wonders of the ocean and the new discoveries of the land of humans. The story begins as Nemo (voice of Alexander Gould) is the only survivor after a shark attacks his mother and the other eggs. Nemo's father takes Nemo under his fins and they begin their new life together. The story unfolds as Nemo is taken by humans from his home on the coral reef. Nemo's father Marlin (voice of Albert Brooks) sets out on his journey to find Nemo and bring him back home. Nemo becomes entrapped in a fish tank, in a dentist's office, where Nemo learns that he is the new present for the Dentist's niece. Nemo befriends the other fish and together they make the escape from the land of humans to the deep waters of the ocean once again. The battles that Marlin and his new found friend Dory (voice of Ellen DeGeneres) encounter on their journey through the dangerous waters will capture the audience's attention and will keep the kids guessing on what will happen next. The vivid colors and real life sounds create a world of imagination and fun as the audience becomes entranced with the feeling of swimming right alongside of these new found friends. Finding Nemo is a family movie that tells the tale of a father -son bond and how far someone will go to save the one they love. We see the theme of defeating all odds and overcoming all obstacles for those you love while battling hand in hand with strangers that they now call friends. We saw how Marlin and Dory survived the chase of a vicious shark and escaped the jaws of an anglerfish as they stayed determined to find and rescue Nemo from the unknown dangers of the open sea and land. The extraordinary will power of Nemo, a young fish, has overcome all the challenges that life has thrown at him and will leave an impression on many young viewers.

Al Brooks, who plays the voice of Marlin, and Ellen Degeneres, who plays the hilarious roll of Dory, outdo any other movies in their unique and clever voice styles. If you haven't seen this movie, I highly recommend that you go see it RIGHT NOW! Rent it at Blockbuster or buy it at Wal-Mart, wherever you get it, just go and watch it NOW! Its a 12/10!! :)

Author: 7 June 2005
Review: Some movies are to young, some movies are to mature, this one's good for all ages!

Author: 2 October 2004
Review_Url: This movie is one of the best I've seen. It managed to be entertaining and hilarious all the way through. Ellen DeGeneres makes a great Dory and Nicholas Bird's cute voice is just perfect for Squirt. And you gotta admire how they used real Aussie actors for parts such as the sharks (I hate fake accents). It's an entertaining, hilarious, amily film (and you don't have to have a family to enjoy it!) I think it deserved the Oscar. The DVD commentary is amusing and informational(unlike "it was great working with this person" crap).It includes an audio track and some nice visual commentary. Anyways, its a clever CGI picture. 10/10

Author: 21 April 2005
Review: Finding Nemo is a children's action that should keep their attention!
Review_Url: A good movie for both kids and adults. It kept my attention and I didn't see that there was anything that would be inappropriate for children. The movie contains a lot of familiar voices that I recognized and a few that I didn't recognize. All the characters were cute and lovable. You might have to explain the difference between Marlin and Nemo to small children, there is a small difference, but it was hard to tell, even for me. There were a bunch of adorable little tag lines like, "Fish are friends not food." "Ride some shell." This is definitely one that should go in the DVD collection at home or in a daycare!
